instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165A: What is 820-00165A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charging light (amber or green)
threads.message:
Hi,

I am fairly new at this but i've the following MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> it present but a little low and i think the SMC stays in reset mode.

I've measured the following power rails:

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 8.20 volts
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.416 volts

<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> = 0.754 volts

<CHIP>U5110</CHIP> voltages:

pin 1 = 3.415
pin 2 = 0.000
pin 3 = 3.414
pin 4 = 2.815
pin 5 = 0.784
pin 6 = 3.399
pin 7 = 3.409
pin 8 = 3.294

I thinking <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is too low whats causing the SMC to keep resetting? What should i do next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charging light (amber or green)
threads.message:
Diode mode to ground?
Check <RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR>.
Clean/remove J6100.
Remove <RESISTOR>R7100</RESISTOR> and check voltage again.
If still low, remove <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> and retest.
SMC is the last option...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charging light (amber or green)
threads.message:
Thanks, 

checked <RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR> which had abnormal values.
Checked J6100, saw a little debris. Cleaned it and the MacBook works again. Thanks!
